rComments: Very good prof with unique teaching style that really makes you remember every class. After each class, there is usually a twist that makes students intrigued. The class material is not difficult to grasp if students are willing to go back and review MGMA01 material. The cases are mainly self-taught and require thinking. Would recommend prof Dewan!

Expects you to figure everything out your own. Don't exactly know what he's being paid for. Wouldn't wish him upon my worst enemy. Should've retired before he even started. Had no respect for marketing before I went in, and now I'm even more convinced it's all a joke.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters']

rComments: He took less time for office hour,and usually do not show up in office hour.
If u pay attention in class, take good notes, keep on top of work and participate this course will be great! Overall, a great prof and course!

Decent prof with god awful TAs. TAs do not even read the weekly assignments and rush to mark it at the very end of the semester. Some fault to Tarun Dewan for choosing these horrible TAs. Exams are clear and simple which makes it easy but still the same amount of effort for every other course. TAs also mark exams hard so you might get bell curved.

Hes actually a great prof. I dont think he gets a lot of credit bc hes one of those profs who actually knows what hes talking about & he doesn't use slides or anything like that. His lectures are conversations & yes we always have other discussions but tbh it helps you remember what he says in lectures. ppl dont like him bc hes vague about projects
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Amazing lectures', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Dewan is an amazing and intelligent person. That being said, he really ruins the marketing experience for UTSC students. He gives everyone 70's, no matter how hard you try. His marking schemes are a joke and don't bother getting caught up in the participation grade aspect, he will give you horrible mark no matter how much you participate. Shameful!

I wish I didnt take this course. No matter how hard you try, he will find a way to pull your mark down (unless you are brown). Not sure if this is a culture thing, but I am not a big fan of this... UTSC needs to fix this and stop letting MB01 be like a joke. No students will respect marketing after taking this course.
Great Professor and very funny. Good introduction to case based courses.

A case writeup each week, so a bunch to do and read. His recommendation/approach for the cases always takes the entire class by surprise. Tough grader for participation marks and attendance is mandatory.
If you want to do better in his class have brown students in your group. You will have more than one opportunity to be in a group. Try it and see.

I find that with Dewan you really need to kiss his ass to pass. He does usually no what he is talking about when he stays on topic, but that rarely happens. Also if you take an exam with him be prepared to find information that you have never seen before. Everyone leaves with a mediocre grade no matter how hard you try, worst prof at this school.
EXACT same course as marketing management. He's a good guy and I enjoy his teaching style... the only thing is... if you have a bad group you get screwed over.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters']

rComments: Very ambiguous grading criteria in regards to group presentations and participation mark. Professor shows up late throughout the semester and appears to assign grade at random.

Especially for this course, he gives you no help at all making you learn all by yourself. its some "training wheels" theory he has...... otherwise he is super nice and makes class fun and go by so fast. There is no textbook for this class either, or exams!

He is a good prof. He often goes off topic but when he does talk about the material he knows what he is talking about. He is quiet helpful and very approachable. I recommend taking the course with him.

EXTREMELY easy going prof - very casual, talkative, class is quite entertaining. He teaches as if the class is a bird course (his ppts do not follow textbook, goes off topic). Yet exams focus heavily on textbook and he does not appear to give over 80%... no matter how much you write, participate - everybody ends up with an 80. Not a GPA booster.
so easy going prof
Easy prof, easy midterm, HARD exam.
Funny prof. always repeats midterms. easy course !! take all the courses you can with dewan as electives !
